fields.breakfast:
3 whole eggs + 3 egg whites scrambled with spinach, mushrooms & tomatoes
1 slice whole-grain toast with 1 tbsp peanut butter
1 medium banana
fields.lunch:
150g grilled chicken breast
1 cup quinoa
1 cup steamed broccoli
1 tbsp olive oil
fields.snacks2: 1 protein shake with 1 scoop whey protein, 1 cup almond milk, 1 tbsp peanut butter
fields.dinner:
200g grilled salmon
1 medium baked potato
1 cup roasted Brussels sprouts
fields.snacks3: 1 small bowl of Greek yogurt with 1 tbsp chia seeds and honey
fields.notes: This plan is ideal for active individuals aiming for moderate muscle gain. The higher protein intake ensures muscle repair and growth, and the balance of carbs helps fuel workouts and promote muscle glycogen storage.

fields.breakfast:
4 scrambled eggs + 3 egg whites with spinach & mushrooms
1 slice whole-grain toast with almond butter
1 avocado
fields.snacks:
1 small apple
1 handful of mixed nuts (30g)
fields.lunch:
200g lean ground turkey
1 cup brown rice
1 cup steamed green beans
1 tbsp olive oil
fields.snacks2: 1 protein shake (2 scoops whey protein, 1 cup oat milk, 1 tbsp peanut butter)
fields.dinner:
250g grilled chicken breast
1 medium sweet potato
1 cup mixed greens with olive oil & balsamic dressing
fields.snacks3: 1 small bowl of cottage cheese (200g) with 1 tbsp honey and 10 walnuts
fields.notes: This meal plan supports individuals who are highly active and want to gain muscle mass efficiently. The protein and carb ratios are designed to support muscle building, with fats to ensure hormonal balance.

fields.breakfast:
5 whole eggs + 3 egg whites scrambled with spinach, bell peppers & tomatoes
1 slice whole-grain toast with 2 tbsp almond butter
1 small banana
fields.snacks:
1 cup low-fat Greek yogurt
1 tbsp chia seeds
1 handful of almonds
fields.lunch:
250g grilled chicken breast
1.5 cups quinoa
1 cup steamed asparagus
1 tbsp olive oil
fields.snacks2: 1 protein shake (2 scoops whey protein, 1 cup oat milk, 1 tbsp peanut butter)
fields.dinner:
300g grilled salmon
1 medium baked potato
1 cup roasted Brussels sprouts & carrots
fields.snacks3: 1 small bowl of cottage cheese (200g) with 1 tbsp chia seeds and honey
fields.notes: This meal plan is meant for bodybuilders or athletes aiming for high muscle gain. The higher calorie intake helps support intense workouts and muscle recovery while keeping fat gain in check.

fields.breakfast:
6 whole eggs + 4 egg whites scrambled with spinach, bell peppers, and onions
2 slices whole-grain toast with 2 tbsp almond butter
1 avocado
fields.snacks:
1 cup cottage cheese (low-fat)
1 apple
1 handful of mixed nuts (30g)
fields.lunch:
300g grilled turkey breast
2 cups brown rice
1 cup steamed broccoli
1 tbsp olive oil
fields.snacks2:
1 protein shake (2 scoops whey protein, 1 cup oat milk, 1 tbsp peanut butter)
1 banana
fields.dinner:
300g grilled lean beef
1 large baked sweet potato
1 cup roasted mixed vegetables (carrots, zucchini, bell peppers)
fields.snacks3: 1 small bowl of Greek yogurt with 2 tbsp chia seeds and 20 almonds
fields.notes: This high-calorie plan is for elite bodybuilders or athletes looking to rapidly gain muscle mass. The meal timing and macronutrient breakdown are designed to optimize muscle recovery and growth while limiting fat accumulation.

fields.breakfast:
7 whole eggs + 4 egg whites scrambled with spinach, tomatoes & onions
2 slices whole-grain toast with 2 tbsp almond butter
1 avocado
fields.snacks:
1 cup full-fat cottage cheese
1 small apple
1 handful of mixed nuts (40g)
fields.lunch:
350g grilled lean beef
2 cups brown rice
1 cup steamed broccoli
1 tbsp olive oil
fields.snacks2:
1 protein shake (3 scoops whey protein, 1 cup oat milk, 1 tbsp peanut butter)
1 banana
fields.dinner:
350g grilled chicken breast
2 medium sweet potatoes
1 cup mixed greens with olive oil & balsamic dressing
fields.snacks3: 1 small bowl of Greek yogurt with 2 tbsp chia seeds and 25 almonds
fields.notes: This extreme muscle gain plan is for advanced athletes or bodybuilders needing a very high-calorie intake to support extreme muscle growth. It focuses on optimizing protein synthesis and glycogen storage to promote rapid recovery and muscle hypertrophy.
